title: Front ABS Wheel Sensor - Removal

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Note the routing of the harness and its retaining clips for installation.
Remove the fixings that attach the expansion tank to the frame. Move the expansion tank to get access to the fixings for the right frame infill panel .
Release the clutch cable clip from the infill panel and move the clutch cable aside.
Remove the two plastic rivets that attach the right frame infill panel and remove the infill panel.

body.name: Front ABS wheel speed sensor connector_B00938

body.body: Disconnect the electrical connector for the wheel speed sensor, identified as the white connector located in front of the ABS modulator.
Release the wheel speed sensor harness from the brake hose clips.
Release the bolt and remove the wheel speed sensor. Collect the shim from between the sensor and the fork leg.

Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.

Perform the following operations:

Battery - Terminal Disconnect
Fuel Tank - Removal

Release the clutch cable clip from the infill panel and move the clutch cable aside.
Remove the two plastic rivets that attach the right frame infill panel and remove the infill panel.
